adjective.description: Reminiscent of a film or theme park created by the Walt Disney Company, especially in being simplified, sanitized, or romanticized.
examples: it presents a very Disney view of the Middle Ages

adjective.description: Denoting a noncustodial parent who, when spending time with their child or children, indulges them with gifts, special outings, and other treats, leaving disciplinary responsibilities to the custodial parent.
examples: he needs to stop playing Disney dad and parent properly
it sounds like your ex is a Disney parent

origin: 1930s: from the name of Walter Elias Disney (see Disney, Walt).
